comment.author: 33722706@N04
comment._content: worthy of note is the conduit street car track visible in 18th st nw; this trackage is a portion of a large loop used as a terminal point for some street car routes. After an extensive route reorganisation and track reconstruction program in the mid nineteen thirties, cars routed via this loop would be signed "Potomac Park" as a destination; cars using this route would travel westbound on Pennsylvania Ave. to a turnout (track switch) at 19th st., south on 19th then southeasterly on Virginia Ave to 18th st. After a short layover, the car would turn north onto 18th st. and past the location of this photo at 18th and E sts. the car then would turn eastbound back onto Pennsylvania Ave.
